content: Could be great, but controls are poorly placed and not very smooth. Not worth $3.

It's Lode Runner. It's definitely a classic. The only problem is that the soft controls leave a lot to be desired. It frequently refuses to accept my inputs, and the character sometimes changes directions without my changing the movement. If that can be fixed, it would be an outstanding port of a great classic. Right now, it is mediocre.
I can only download and install it on the specific device I bought it on? Instant refund.
YES,I came into the Lode Runner series from Lode Runner Legacy and really enjoyed it. And I found there's a mobile version, which is awesome! :D

The UI for controls really sucks whether using touch or gamepad mode. in touch mode i try to go up and the menu comes up. if i try to go down a ladder sometimes it burns bc it doesn't react right away so i hold it a bit more. Then of course it responds & jump right in to the hole I just burned. On a pc I was always level 100+. Can't even get through level 1 here.
Sort out the damn controls please!!!
Glitchy game

Not pleased, especially after paying for one of my favourite childhood games. The controls on this are absolutely awful. The D Pad would be my preference, but you can't move left unless you keep your finger held down and spin left. You should be able to simply touch left, touch right. The other setup is awful. I want a refund if I cant enjoy this game.
I achieved all 20 achievements. Thanks for bringing the old game in android.
When I play the game.My tablet suddenly said "Unfortunately Lode Runner has stopped".I want this game fixed and I will give u five stars
Awful game controls.

Fun, not quite the same but fun. I played this game quite extensively back in the '80s on an Apple IIe. I have routes for several levels memorized, but they don't work for this game because the gameplay is different. Most noticeable is that the "bad guys" are slower. On the original, I could run over 3 bad guys if they fell into the blasted holes one right after the other but it was really hard to do before the first one that fell in started getting back out. This makes the game easier, though.
controls are terrible. save your money
controls suck really bad.
i like it but the controls are awful.
fun old game....
need a way to completely disable sounds, game control needs big improvement, quite inaccurate
Randomly looses game save
Great potential from a true classic. Please add keyboard support!
Reminds me of grade school

Bringing back my childhood memories. The control has been improved, thanks to the dev that's listening to the comments. I like also the color scheme changing feature for us to customize the feel of the game. Anyway bricks look better in orange :)
It doesnt support MOGA controllers as it said it does :-(
The controls need major Improvement, keep dying because instead of going up the character goes to the left,  etc. It would be awesome if this was fixed.
Like it!

It is just like the original! However, while it's MOGA enhanced, it doesn't accept any other controllers. My controllers work with any other controller-based games. I asked the dev team but they haven't responded after a month.

Lode Runner is a classic, but this version has totally crappy controls. Why use accelerometer (which is too imprecise for quick changes of direction), why emulate arrow keys / gamepad on screen? This is touch screen, for god's sake! Let the player tap a spot for the character to run there!
great game...just like in the 80s
Loved it on the Apple IIc. Needs an edit mode. Used to have a ton of self-made levels. Needs to be joystick compatible.

Used 2 play on Apple II all the time. This version brings back lots of memories. The graphics & gameplay are spot on compared 2 memories of it. Would have given 5 stars but the controls suck! I miss my simple cheap joystick of the Apple II! Have ordered a Moga pro style controller. If this doesn't fix it I will have 2 pass on completing every level...
No gamepad support

Worked for one day, now all it does is say "Unfortunately, Lode Runner has stopped". This is on a Moto G 2014. Deleted cache, restarted phone, reinstalled app, nothing works to fix this. ** After clearing cache and reinstalling, now works **
Аркады не для тачскрина...
Even though I love the original, an Android port could still be hit-or-miss. Kudos for giving me an option to get a refund if it doesn't work out

Played Load Runner back in the early 80s and with a joy stick.  No such luck here!  Bought a gamepad by Sabrent and it won't work on the Android Lollipop.  Can you fix it for a 5th star rating and a revised review of the game?
Love it, takes me back to my youth. Still a blast. Now I play it with my son.

On-screen d-pad control was not comparable to original keyboard control on C64, but at the slowest speed it was not that bad and quite playable with a few mistakes though. It was comfortable to play at the slowest speed since I had time to think, made some mistakes and still won the levels.
Used to play this as a youngster with my dad.  Brings back fond memorie.
Great game. Good controls.
Best ZX Spectrum game running on Android! No bug till 98 level.
The games is just like the old one. However I wish you could flip around the dpad for right hand use. Its difficult. The touch pad doesn't work that well. The game is still fun.
Would be a 5 star game if the Dpad was just 4 separate buttons where my thumb could clearly be on 1 at a time. I have dropped or dug in wrong spot too many times!
This is my favorite old skool game and its available for Android, finally.
Good game reminder of my childhood.  but like the rest of the reviews the Dpad control seems to have a mind of its own sometimes.
Twice I've installed this. Won't even work! On my galaxy s5 android. Hope I get a refund!!!
same version as old apple plateform ,ok for fun

A good effort at recreating a classic Apple II game.  The graphics are nice (though a higher resolution option might be fun to look at, as well as classic Apple II green screen), and you can't beat those puzzles.  Unfortunately, as anyone who played this on the Apple II (which had a standard analog joystick) will tell you, it's best played with digital controls (most people just used the keyboard back in the day).  However, they added Moga support but no HID gamepad support or keyboard support.  Worse, I own the Moga Hero Power and it actually maps the game to the analog stick only.  Playing a game as fast as lode runner, requiring precise digital controls, just doesn't work well with the Moga analog stick or, I suspect, any analog stick.  It's a shame they didn't make it work with standard bluetooth/HID controllers, most of which have gamepads, or keyboard presses (which can be mapped to many keyboards and android game controllers).  Please update this to include HID support and mappable keyboard controls so everyone can have fun with the precise control the game requires.

Used to be a great game but this is buggy as hell. Enemies run through walls on some levels and the controls could be better. I could deal with the controls but making me pay for something that is full of bugs which cost you the game just sucks. Really disappointed as I used to love this game.
Just played thru a few levels and, despite the controls being a tad cranky, it was as fun and frantic as I recall.
Use to fun until you had to login to googleplay.
The controls are horrible.
Try providing the option to switch from left to right handed with tap for bombing?

I loved Lode runner in the 80s and this looks almost exactly like it but the controls are incredibly frustrating. Try to drill left. End up drilling right and dying. Try to run away. End up drilling and blocking your way Instead. Even the easy levels take forever to clear because the game doesn't do what you tell it to. And I don't want to register on google play so stop asking every time I start the game.
Brings back memories of the original version on computer
I got so excited to find this game and relive my childhood, but the controls are so awkward and just frustrating. It would be an amazing game if the controls were better.
The controls don't work very well.

I was excited to see that the owner of the Lode Runner license had released the game in an Android version. It appears that the conversion was done by Studio Voltz, and all I can say is that someone blew it, big time. Specifically, the controls for this game are well-nigh unusable.  A simple relocatable screen-overlaid joystick (as in, e.g., Terraria) would have made this game a joy. As it is, there are three control options, all terrible.  Let's examine them one by one!  First, there's the D-Pad.  This shrinks the size of the game screen to approximately half of its original size (by square area), in order to make room for gigantic d-pad buttons. I can barely see the game screen. Next.  Second, there's the on-screen controls. Rather than using a flexible relative-to-click-position joystick, this game simply maps screen areas to joystick positions. This means that if you want to move up, you must place your finger at the top of the screen, completely obscuring the screens. Might work for people with extremely narrow fingers. Next.  Third, there's the tip-screen. Urrg. No thanks.  Frankly, I think it reflects quite poorly on Studio Voltz that they let this one out the door.
This is a fantastic game that they adopted to the touch screen incredibly well.
Was very excited to play this. Would be fantastic if only the controls were better. Unplayable as it is.
It plays great on my Nexus 7 and Galaxy S4, but a controller is a must.
Control is a bit iffy on the touch screen.

I loved this game when I was playing it on my C64. I was excited when I found this app and I'm impressed just how similar this is to the original game. The way the guards behave is exactly how it was on the Commodore game and I still remember how to take advantage of the limited inteligence of the algoritm that controls the guards.  Having said that, so far I've found that the user controls are very bad. I tried the D-pad, the touch and the accelerometer, but none of them work good enough.

This game would be great if the controls actually worked well. The Dpad control doesn't work, the touch control is too awkward and the accelerometer control isn't accurate enough. Not worth the money.
Cant turn off the annoying music?????
This crashes out on my galaxy S2, as soon as you select anything on the main title. :(
I love this game. I used to play it on my palm pda and now I play it on my android phone and I use my moga controller. It doesn't get better than that!
I was very excited to see this game.  Didnt even mind paying for it...the excitment ended when I tried to play it however.  Very poorly supported.
Update renders dpad controls totally useless. I'm going to try the other control schemes, but I've already played 25 levels with the dpad,  so I'm really disappointed with this change.  Galaxy s4

The game is a lot of fun, and this is coming from someone who's never played the original. However, there is some random slowdown that doesn't seem to be alleviated by a lack of background processes.   Also, I thought the level editor was a big sell point of the original? They really ought to bring that functionality back in.   I just expected more polish considering the surprisingly high price point for this sort of game.
Good clean retro fun
It's great going back down memory lane
The music cuts out and the screen action freezes. This game brings back awsome memories, if only it worked correctly. If the issues could be fixed you could have a droid classic in the making.
Playing on HTC one x, no problem
Flashback to apple IIe days... Nostalgic

Bought this out of nostalgia, but Jesus the dammed thing does not work at all. Basically a gamble. Avoid! Update: tried this on another android device, and it doesn't work on it there either. Looks irresponsible.

This runs at about 2 fps on my tablet. It is totally unplayable.  My tablet (dual-core A9 @1.5 GHz, Mali GPU, Android 4.0.3) is capable of running some fairly sophisticated 3D games at 1280x800 with a good framerate; I have no idea why this app is so slow.

It is the original. I play it on my phone no problems. I play it on my tablet and the buttons are huge. Needs to have tablet support (Direction control buttons on the left and lasers right or vise versa [upon user preference]) .
Freezes after load next game/retry every time on DROID X2...but runs fine on my Samsung Galaxy 7.  Please fix!

Played this on my Apple IIC as a kid. I got all kinds of problems with this. Bought the game early knowing there might be some glitches that needed fixing but it was a mistake. Just cuz u got the license for the original name means nothing, it's still janky as F$&k!
Pressed any buttons on the menu screen, and hanged.  Then quite.  Please fix.
One of my favorites from way back.  Great port!

Needs performance tweaks on galaxy s3.  Goes from smooth to jerky seemingly randomly.  Only email is running in background.  Controls are tough to get right but I understand the limitations on a smartphone.  Otherwise a perfect port of a game I grew up playing.  Looking forward to updates.   Thanks!
Should be designed much better In line with Holo concept
Very good old classic. Love it.
Controller sucks!
(: oh yeah :)
Super excellent classic. This takes a person waay back. I definitely recommend this to anyone who likes these old vintage games.
Things seem to fall off the screen on my Nexus 10 tablet.  Thank you for porting this great game classic.
Just like the good old days

This is retro game heaven, My favorite retro gaming experience on android hands down has been Mole Miner.Well the highest compliment I can give Lode Runner beside the fact i been playing it for 2 hours straight is i enjoy it almost has much. OK maybe equally. This is the real deal folks get this app!

This brings back some memories.. thanks for the Android port!
Have been waiting for this since September when it came to Windows. Been checking the Play Store every day since. A little tricky to get to used to
